title: HOW TO CHECK OCE SERVER PING BEFORE MATCH
body:
Ok guys so after hours and hours of searching for the IP address, I have finally found it (OCE SERVER).

All you have to do to check your ping before a match is:

- Open notepad.
- Copy this exactly into the document:

@echo off
cls
Set IPaddress=203.174.139.185
PING %IPaddress% -t
call :PingTest

- Save as and change the .txt to .bat (example: pingtest.bat)

- Open file. :){{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

replies.body: or you could just start a custom game like a normal person and see what your ping is
It takes 15 seconds to make a file that can ping and check it for you at any time. Normal people are doing it the hard way.
Is there a way i could do this on a mac??

You can open terminal on mac and type

> ping 203.174.139.185

Then press Ctrl + C to stop it.
but what does that ping mean? i dont understand the numbers

the "ms" is your ping for the server
for example 55ms means 55 ping

Where did you get that IP from? The OCE server listed on the [Network page here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2) isn't that, and only the NA server plays well with ping requests, so the rest you have to run a tracert to them and ping the last hop to it instead. [(SephirothSG made a great batch file that runs them all at once in a neat package)](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-creations/Qgqm11ad-i-made-a-non-closed-source-ping-testing-tool-for-oce-other-regions) (also, your last hop could be different from his, but should be close)

Anyway, the script doesn't have to be that complicated. All it needs to be is;

> ping 203.174.139.185 -t

And tell them to press Ctrl + C to stop it.
Well done, very helpful. Beats going to deepfocus every time :)

Or you could just open a cmd and type
ping 203.174.139.185
simple

you don't need all that. Just press Window key + R and type ping 203.174.139.185 -t

and press enter.

thats all

An even better and quicker way of finding your ping would be to open Command prompt (preferably with admin rights)
type "ping 203.174.139.185 -t"
and it should give you your ping in real time
for example here is a line that might show up in CMD
"Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=42ms TTL=59"
the "time=42ms" is my live ping. CMD will be constantly refreshing you with your live ping from the Oceanic server. You can use this code for any servers or any game or just your own router ,granted that you know the IP address of the server. just replace the OCE IP address with the new address and voila! live ping testing
OMG THIS REALLY WORKS. I just did it. haha thanks mate.

{{champion:222}} there 
this is amazing dude .. thank you very much..
i think there's something wrong with oce servers coz those days their ping i very high. but i asked from my friend who playing in EU and he told me that his ping is just 98. i checked my ping at oce. its 525 

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}} 

( 2016 /07 /04 : 12.11PM Sri Lanka )
No problem guys :) Much easier than starting custom games indeed.

Dude this is so helpful! it takes literally 2 seconds for me to check my ping! you're a legend! its hard to use {{champion:429}} with high ping. this is amazingly helpful when i main her. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
